alert.note: Alert for Dent (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 4:54PM CDT until August 29 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Dent, Shannon and Texas. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Gladden Creek at County Road 624, Dry Fork Creek at County Road 2430 and Gladden Creek at Highway KK. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jadwin, Darien, Gladden, Akers, Turtle and Montauk. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
